title: Saudi Aramco’s public listing will attract public scrutiny. It won’t be comfortable
text:
It's amazing what $450m can get you. Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman Al-Saud will have to fork out a king’s ransom on an army of advisers to float Aramco, the state-backed oil giant, on the stock market.

According to Saudi television the long-awaited on-again, off-again share sale will finally be launched on Nov 3, with trading starting roughly a month later.

The move will be hailed as a triumph in the conservative kingdom. This is the world’s largest and most profitable company by a long shot. It is sitting on a fifth of the world’s oil reserves and once it goes public will be worth more than the top five listed oil companies – Exxon, Shell, Chevron, BP, and Total – put together.

A listing...
description: It's amazing what $450m can get you.
